title: Line 39 2016 Excursion Red (California)
description: Plenty of grapey, jammy aromas and flavors fill this medium-bodied wine to the rim. It is lightly sweet, very fruity, and smooth and soft in texture.

title: Lucinda & Millie 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Delicate apple, pear and mineral flavors give a fruity but lean personality to this light-bodied wine. It makes good, basic refreshment.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Madonna Liebfraumilch White (Rheinhessen)
description: Intensely savory notes of crushed earth and pollen juxtapose prettier red apple and tangerine. While rustic in style, its light body and subtle tangerine sweetness offers approachable refreshment.

title: San Marzano 2016 Il Pumo Sauvignon-Malvasia White (Salento)
description: This 50-50 blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Malvasia is a bit closed on the nose. The palate offers more in its juicy melon and apple flavors, with a hint of florals in the background. This is light in weight and intensity, yet perfect for the price.

title: Schmidt 2016 Albariño (Applegate Valley)
description: The winery's white wines are extraordinarily high in alcohol, which inevitably blows out any subtleties and varietal character. This is thick, fruity, almost syrupy, with principal flavors of canned peaches.

title: Schmidt 2016 Lot 1 Riesling (Southern Oregon)
description: The label suggests that this is done in a sweeter style, though it's principally the superripe fruit that you taste. Round and simple, with flavors of peaches, it doesn't deliver the aromatics or the flavor complexity of most Oregon Rieslings.

title: The Pines 1852 2014 Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: Volatile aromas get things off to a difficult start, with a burning sensation and a touch of vinegar. Thin berry fruit and a hint of vanilla wafer come across in the mouth. Two bottles tasted. Drink up.

title: Tierhoek 2015 Chenin Blanc (Piekenierskloof)
description: Soft scents of white flowers, pear and peach subtly make themselves known on the nose of this direct wine. It's lightweight and approachable, with ripe-fruit and sweet-orange flavors that flesh out the palate. Drink now.

title: Château Clos du Moulin 2015  Médoc
description: At this stage, the wood-aging component of this wine dominates the gentle black fruits. An element of high toast and black-chocolate extraction flavors give bitterness. It seems this wine will always have a hard edge.

title: Burgo Viejo 2009 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Soupy raisin and prune aromas are earthy and sleepy. This feels a lot like prune juice, but with tannins. Prune is also the sole flavor on this overripe but still decent gran reserva from a hot vintage.

title: California Roots 2015 Red (California)
description: A good amount of fruit concentration gives this medium-bodied wine likeable aromas and flavors, while a soft smooth texture and a dab of sweetness make it easy on the palate.

title: Airlie 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine seems awkward—there is no other way to put it. Unintegrated, lumbery oak flavors jut out in front of brambly berry fruit. Nothing hangs together and the oak treatment is rough and outsized.

title: Arrumaco 2016 Verdejo (Spain)
description: Pleasant white-fruit aromas are simple. This has a fresh but highly basic mouthfeel. Melony flavors come with green pyrazine notes, while this is dilute on the finish.

title: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2016 Triton Old Vines  (Toro)
description: Heavily charred aromas suggest a steak or hamburger left on the grill for too long. In the mouth, this is compact and boxed in by rock-hard tannins. Like the nose, this young Toro tastes burnt and grilled. Flavors of black coffee and clove dominate an oak-driven finish.

title: Schmidt 2016 Pinot Gris (Southern Oregon)
description: A light straw color, with a hint of tawny skin, this is a blocky, simple and fruity style, high in alcohol with flavors of peaches. There isn't much to it beyond that one-dimensional fruit, and it finishes short and quick.

title: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2014 Alejairén Airen (La Mancha)
description: This golden oak-aged Airén smells almost entirely of wood grain and vanilla. On the palate, it's resiny to an extreme. Flavors of raw wood and coconut are devoid of fruit, while this tastes like liquid oak on the finish.

title: De Moya 2016 Tibó Meseguera (Valencia)
description: Tropical fruit and sucking-candy aromas are inoffensive and lively. This varietal Merseguera is texturally pulpy but also zippy due to high acidity and only 12% abv. Lime and lychee flavors finish quickly.

title: Egeo 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Nectarine and orange aromas are basic and yeasty. A peachy, pulpy palate with flavors of orange and bitter grape skins loses fruit rapidly on the finish.

title: Merriam 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is somewhat dull in texture and elusive in fruit, offering a strong sense of oak and sulfur.

title: Torres 2014 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)
description: The nose of this wine is melony and chunky, with a touch of oak. The palate feels solid enough but still a bit mushy, while dry, creamy flavors of tropical fruits are diffuse in front of a finish that's low in verve.

title: Whitetail Ridge 2014 Valo White (Umpqua Valley)
description: This wine is already past its prime. The blend of Müller-Thurgau, Viognier and Moscato is interesting, but the fruit is fading into a simple, lightly peachy syrup, with a hint of plastic. Drink now.

title: Albada 2014 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Raisiny, saucy aromas are slightly volatile. A wide, saturated palate comes up short on focus and acidity, while a mix of raisin and green-herb flavors lands on a heavy finish.

title: Apothic 2015 Inferno Red (California)
description: A strong, smoky aroma and equally obvious oak flavors dominate this very full-bodied and fairly smooth-textured wine that was aged in whiskey barrels. It's a one-note song, recommended for people who really like that note.

title: Cuatro Rayas 2016 Cuarenta Vendimias Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A nose with mild citrus and banana aromas is indicative of the fleshy but basic wine that follows. Dry flavors of peach pit are slightly bitter, and it's dull on the finish. This wine marks Cuatro Rayas's 40th year.

title: Bodega Classica 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Stalky cherry and berry aromas announce a lean, tart palate with a texture influenced by grape skins. Plum and currant flavors are thin, and this is earthy, tangy and low on ripeness on the finish.

title: Château Doyac 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This dense and rich wine is dominated by dark-chocolate flavors of excessive extraction and bitterness. The fruit is hard to find in this wine that will probably remain tough.

title: Belondrade 2016 Quinta Apolonia Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Briny, wayward aromas of grape skins and yeast are funky and unfocused. This Verdejo has a pulpy, soft mouthfeel and flat white-fruit flavors that turn bitter on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Dominio de la Abadesa 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A dull gold tint and steamrolling barrel aromas announce an oak-heavy wine that's tight, resiny and high in acid. Woody flavors of salted apricot echo on the finish.

title: Eden Ridge 2013 Barrel Select Red (California)
description: This medium-bodied straightforward wine has good fruit flavors and a few hints of black pepper and tobacco to keep it interesting. The texture is smooth and only a light touch of tannin shows through.

title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 Estate Cuvée Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: As most Methven Pinots are estate grown, it's not entirely clear what distinguishes this from the others. What it does show, rather agressively, are aromas of leather. Those same flavors render the wine thin, astringent and bitter, amplifying the drying tannins.
